Package io.github.jgame.image

Class SurfaceMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.image.SurfaceMap
  • public class SurfaceMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Extension of BufferedImage

    For scaling coordinates between two panes and blitting it to the screen.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.awt.Graphics2D g2d

      Resized image ready for blitting!
      private Vector2 scroll
      Where to blit the topleft of the img for the map to be scrolled properly

    • Field Detail

      • g2d

        public java.awt.Graphics2D g2d
        Graphics2D to blit to. (Blit to this to blit to the entire SurfaceMap)

      • img

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage img
        The raw image.

      • resized

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage resized
        Resized image ready for blitting!

      • scroll

        private Vector2 scroll
        Where to blit the topleft of the img for the map to be scrolled properly

        (For the correct position on the map to be centered onscreen propery)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SurfaceMap

        public SurfaceMap​(int x,
                  int y,
                  int type)
        Parameters:
        x - Width of SurfaceMap
        y - Height of SurfaceMap
        type - Type of BufferedImage (default BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB)

    • Method Detail

      • getPos

        public Vector2 getPos​(Vector2 pos)
        Convert a position on a screen to a position on a SurfaceMap based on what was calculated in getScroll(io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, java.awt.Dimension, io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, boolean, boolean)

        NOTE: THIS METHOD DEPENDS ON getScroll(io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, java.awt.Dimension, io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, boolean, boolean)

        Parameters:
        pos - Position on the screen
        Returns:
        Position on the SurfaceMap

      • fill

        public void fill​(java.awt.Color color)
        Fill the entire buffered image with the color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to fill

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the image. Simply creates a new BufferedImage with the same dimensions and type.

      • getGraphics

        public java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics()
        Return the image's graphics if g2d is null, otherwise g2d
        Returns:
        Graphics2D

      • reloadGraphics

        public void reloadGraphics()
        Reload the graphics. Set the g2d to {@link #img}.getGraphics()

      • fromPos

        public Vector2 fromPos​(Vector2 pos)
        Convert a position the SurfaceMap to a position on a screen based on what was calculated in getScroll(io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, java.awt.Dimension, io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, boolean, boolean)

        NOTE: THIS METHOD DEPENDS ON getScroll(io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, java.awt.Dimension, io.github.jgame.math.Vector2, boolean, boolean)

        Parameters:
        pos - Position on the SurfaceMap
        Returns:
        Position on the screen

      • getResized

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getResized​(java.awt.Dimension dim,
                                               double[] multipliers)
        Get resized BufferedImage relative to dimensions.
        Parameters:
        dim - Size of the screen
        multipliers - Multipliers (multiplied by the size of the screen to get the size of the new image)
        Returns:
        BufferedImage

      • blitTo

        public void blitTo​(java.awt.Graphics2D screen)
        Blit the SurfaceMap to the screen. NOTE: THIS METHOD DEPENDS ON getResized(java.awt.Dimension, double[])
        Parameters:
        screen - Graphics to blit to

      • getScroll

        public Vector2 getScroll​(Vector2 target,
                         java.awt.Dimension screen,
                         Vector2 center,
                         boolean lockX,
                         boolean lockY)
        Calculate where to blit the SurfaceMap on screen centering target at center.

        NOTE: THIS METHOD DEPENDS ON getResized(java.awt.Dimension, double[])

        Parameters:
        target - Position to scroll to on the SurfaceMap
        screen - Dimensions of the screen
        center - Where to center target on the screen
        lockX - Lock the x coordinate of target to center on the screen
        lockY - Lock the y coordinate of target to center on the screen
        Returns:
        Position to blit the SurfaceMap at.
